author: _shemnon
content: For a good fuzz you need to implement the fields in https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7756 - at least `functionDepth` and `section`

author: _shemnon
content: Also, note that PC=0 is the beginning of the container for tracing, not the start of the code section or the first code section.  So the first PC of an EOF container will typically be pc=19 or some other number in the teens

author: _shemnon
content: (sorry for the delay, been chasing other dragons)

author: jochembrouwer
content:
I think I missed a lot of EOF updates lately. Is there a central source somewhere about the devnets? Am I correct that eof-devnet-0 is not yet up? And eof-devnet-1 expands eof-devnet-0 with "new" EOF EIPs? And devnet-2 adds even more? Are these supposed to be launched X weeks after the other network launched, or all at the same time? I listened to ACD but I think I am not yet getting the point of these 3 devnets ðŸ˜…  

I also have a PR for the InitcodeTransaction https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9561
We cannot use 0x05 for tx type since this is used in 7702 authority signing

author: jochembrouwer
content: If there is a doc somewhere regarding the devnet testing plan (and also EEST tests for these devnets) please link me to that, I'd gladly study it ðŸ˜„

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yup thanks, I saw in the docs also ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: I'm trying to figure out the reason why we need InitcodeTransaction. I believe the reason is code introspection. But in https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7698 the only way to create the first EOF contract is to have `to: null` and calldata which marks it as EOF container. How can we then still do code introspection? Or is there another reason why we need the initcode transaction? I can't seem to find this out ðŸ˜…
